sub_title: Senior Agriculture / Value Chain Advisor in COVID-19 response and Resilience Project at SNV
summary:
Presently working at SNV as Senior Agriculture / Value Chain Advisor in a COVID-19 response and resilience project (CORE) providing backstopping, guidance and exchange/learning to a portfolio of nine major ongoing projects. These large projects are implemented by the Netherlands Development Organisation (SNV) and financed by the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MoFA). My specific responsibilities are climate and socio-economic resilience strengthening through consumer orientation in local food chains and markets, making optimum use of digitalization and rapid analytics. Before rejoining SNV, I worked at the Technical Centre for Agricultural and Rural Cooperation (CTA), a joint institution of African, Caribbean, and Pacific (ACP) countries and the EU under the Cotonou Agreement. I was part of the CTA management team and managed an investment portfolio of 20M Euro in innovative value chain projects with a special emphasis to integrate digitalisation in agribusiness and value chain development. Before joining CTA, I was SNV team leader of a large World Bank-funded value chain project in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and co-managed two large value chain projects in Nepal funded by respectively the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) and the Asian Development Bank (ADB). 

I am educated in both agricultural science and agribusiness, and my interest is in the area of new institutional economics. This uses transaction risks for explaining business arrangements or the way “business is being done” as brought further to perfection with Nassim Taleb’s 'Skin in the Game'. The experiences with an innovative value chain project in Ethiopia, I extensively documented in the publication 'Pro-poor Value Chain Development, Private sector-led innovative practices in Ethiopia'.

I am result-oriented and analytical by nature, and able to stimulate team members to innovate and perform. With my proven track record in programme and project development, acquisition and management, I managed larger portfolios and projects in several countries, often in difficult circumstances.

As an expert in developing agribusiness, I drive innovative solutions for sustainable markets, climate-smart adaptation, digitalisation, food and nutrition security, and youth and women entrepreneurship.  I completed long-term management and advisory assignments in Asia, Africa, and Europe, covering 8 countries and working in international development with diverse funding bodies.

profile_positions.description:
CTA Team Leader Agribusiness and Value Chain in the areas of agribusiness, climate-and nutrition-smart value chains, youth entrepreneurship, maximizing the integration of digitalisation, Wageningen, The Netherlands.

Managing the Agribusiness and Value Chain Team and part of the Management Team of the Technical Centre for Agricultural and Rural Cooperation (CTA), being a joint institution of African, Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) countries and EU under the Cotonou Agreement. As the team leader, I managed an investment portfolio of 20M Euro of innovative projects in ACP countries, involving 15 programme coordinators, programme assistants, and interns. This was done in selected sub-sectors, developing and scaling business cases in which the benefits of digitalisation are optimally used. Strategic areas were climate adaptation, youth entrepreneurship and employment and women empowerment, contributing to specific CTA’s targets.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Agribusiness and Value Chain

profile_positions.description:
SNV Team Leader of World Bank funded 'Projet des Pôles de Croissance Ouest' to develop the rice, cassava and oil palm value chains in the Kongo Central province.


Represented the Netherlands Development Organisation (SNV) in the DRC and managed both operationally and financially a 16.3M USD and World Bank-funded Value Chain project. The project was implemented in the province of Kongo Central with the objective to increase productivity and employment in three selected value chains in six specific geographical clusters.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager and Agribusiness Expert

profile_positions.description:
Sector Leader Agricultural Programme for SNV Nepal and SNV Team Leader of the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) funded Project to Develop High-value Agricultural Value Chains with a strong focus on Inclusiveness.

Manage the agricultural programme of SNV-Nepal with strategy development, project acquisition and the management of 5 projects, involving 15-20 advisors, covering the strategic themes of sustainable markets, climate adaptation, and food/nutrition security. This included the provision of expertise leadership in value chain development to an 18.8M US$ project funded by the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) and a 20.1M US$ project funded by the Asian Development Bank (ADB).
profile_positions.title: Sector Leader Agriculture SNV Nepal and SNV Team Leader High Value Agricultural Project (HVAP)

profile_positions.description:
Senior Value Chain Advisor and Learning Coordinator for the Value Chain Interventions of SNV Ethiopia.


Expertise leader value chain development of a team of 15-20 value chain advisors in an Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands (EKN) and Irish Embassy 9M US$ private sector-led innovative value chain development project. This 6 years project facilitated the value chain upgrading in the fruits, dairy, apiculture, and oilseeds sub-sectors. It was characterized by the combination of strengthening the overall enabling sector environment as well as supporting individual businesses as traders/exporters, processors and farmer organisations, and service providers in their business and service relationships. As the main editor, a substantial contribution was made to this generally recognized successful BOAM project, with the book 'Pro-poor Value Chain Development, Private sector-led innovative practices in Ethiopia'. BOAM as a private sector-led innovative value chain project has strongly influenced the Agricultural Growth Plan of the Government of Ethiopia,
